data.title: Artie Lange Movies and TV Shows – Just Speak News
data.text:
Artie Lange is a multi-talented comedian, actor, and writer known for his unique sense of humor and larger-than-life personality. From his stand-up comedy specials to his appearances in movies and TV shows, Lange has left an indelible mark on the entertainment industry. In this article, we will explore some of the most notable Artie Lange movies and TV shows that have made him a beloved figure among comedy enthusiasts.

Movies:

1. “Dirty Work” (1998): In this comedy film, Lange plays the role of Sam, the best friend of the main character, Mitch (played by Norm Macdonald). The duo starts a revenge-for-hire business, leading to hilarious and outrageous situations.

2. “Artie Lange’s Beer League” (2006): Not only did Lange star in this film, but he also co-wrote and produced it. It revolves around a group of misfits who form a softball team and find themselves in a series of comic misadventures.

3. “Elf” (2003): Although Lange has a small role in this holiday classic, his character, the department store Santa, provides some memorable comedic moments alongside Will Ferrell.

4. “Lost & Found” (1999): In this romantic comedy, Lange plays a supporting role as Wally, a friend of the main character, Dylan (played by David Spade). It showcases Lange’s ability to bring humor to even the smallest roles.

TV Shows:

1. “The Howard Stern Show”: Lange is best known for his time as a regular on this popular radio show. His witty banter, hilarious impressions, and outrageous stories made him a fan favorite during his nine-year tenure.

2. “MADtv” (1995-1997): Lange’s time as a cast member on this sketch comedy show further solidified his comedic chops. Known for his memorable characters and impressions, Lange became a standout performer during his time on the show.

3. “Crashing” (2017-2019): Created by Pete Holmes, this HBO comedy series stars Lange as a fictionalized version of himself, serving as a mentor to the main character, Pete (played by Holmes). This semi-autobiographical show provides a glimpse into Lange’s personal life and struggles with addiction.

4. “The Norm Show” (1999-2001): In this sitcom, Lange plays the role of Norm Henderson’s (played by Norm Macdonald) best friend and roommate, providing plenty of comedic moments with his quick wit and hilarious one-liners.

Now, let’s move on to some frequently asked questions about Artie Lange:

1. Is Artie Lange still doing stand-up comedy?

Yes, although Lange has faced personal challenges, he continues to perform stand-up comedy shows across the United States.

2. Is Artie Lange still sober?

Lange has had well-documented struggles with addiction throughout his life. While he has had periods of sobriety, he has also faced relapses. As of now, the most recent information suggests that he is working towards recovery.

3. What is Artie Lange’s most famous role?

Lange’s most famous role is arguably his time as a regular on “The Howard Stern Show.” His dynamic on-air presence and comedic contributions made him a beloved figure among Stern fans.

4. Has Artie Lange written any books?

Yes, Lange has written two memoirs: “Too Fat to Fish” (2008) and “Crash and Burn” (2013). These books provide an intimate look into Lange’s life and career, including his battles with addiction.

5. Has Artie Lange won any awards for his work?

While Lange has not won any major awards, his contributions to comedy and entertainment have earned him a dedicated fan base and critical acclaim.

6. Is Artie Lange active on social media?

Yes, Lange is active on social media platforms such as Twitter (@artiequitter) and Instagram (@artielange67), where he often shares updates, interacts with fans, and showcases his humor.

7. Has Artie Lange appeared in any other TV shows?

Yes, Lange has made guest appearances on various TV shows, including “Entourage,” “Louie,” and “Rescue Me,” among others.

8. Is Artie Lange married?

Lange was previously married to Dana Cironi from 2002 to 2006. However, they divorced, and Lange has not remarried.

9. Has Artie Lange released any comedy albums?

Yes, Lange has released several comedy albums, including “It’s the Whiskey Talkin'” (2004) and “Jack and Coke” (2009), which showcase his stand-up comedy talents.

10. Does Artie Lange have any upcoming projects?

As of now, there have been no official announcements about any upcoming projects involving Lange. However, fans eagerly await any news of his return to the entertainment industry.

11. What makes Artie Lange’s comedy style unique?

Lange’s comedy style is known for its raw honesty, self-deprecating humor, and ability to find humor in even the darkest of situations. His ability to connect with audiences through storytelling sets him apart from other comedians.

12. Are there any plans for a “Dirty Work” sequel?

As of now, there have been no official plans announced for a sequel to “Dirty Work.” However, the cult following and popularity of the original film have sparked occasional rumors and speculation.

13. What is Artie Lange’s net worth?

While exact figures are difficult to determine, Lange’s net worth is estimated to be around $500,000. However, it’s important to note that financial situations can change over time.

In conclusion, Artie Lange’s filmography and TV appearances have brought laughter and joy to audiences worldwide. From his memorable roles in movies like “Dirty Work” and “Beer League” to his unforgettable time on “The Howard Stern Show,” Lange’s comedic talent continues to captivate fans. Despite personal challenges, Lange’s contributions to the entertainment industry remain cherished, and fans eagerly await his potential return to the spotlight.
